assets.title: Docker Container Management with Python
assets.raw:
import docker

client = docker.from_env()

# Pull an image
image = client.images.pull('alpine', tag='latest')

# Run a container
container = client.containers.run('alpine', 'echo hello world')

# List containers
for container in client.containers.list():
  print(container.id)

annotations.text: This code snippet uses the docker library to pull an image, run a container with 'echo hello world', and then lists all containers. It prints the ID of each container in the list by calling it on that point at this time.
Python script using the Docker SDK to manage containers, pull images, and list container IDs.
